title: Synthesis, in vitro biological evaluation and in silico studies of novel pyrrolidine derived thiosemicarbazones as dihydrofolate reductase inhibitors
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,31409-31421
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA05071A, Paper

Hina Aftab, Saeed Ullah, Ajmal Khan, Mariya al-Rashida, Talha Islam, Abdulrahman Alshammari, Norah A. Albekairi, Parham Taslimi, Ahmed Al-Harrasi, Zahid Shafiq, Saeed Alghamdi
Dihydrofolate reductase (DHFR) is a crucial enzyme involved in folate metabolism and serves as a prime target for anticancer and antimicrobial therapies.
